title: InsertWallclockDateTimePart Single Message Transform (Lenses)
description: Configuration schema for InsertWallclockDateTimePart transformation. Inserts specific parts of the current date and time (year, month, day, hour, etc.) into record headers.

header.name.description: The name of the header to insert the date/time part into.
header.name.title: header.name

date.time.part.description: The part of the date/time to extract. Options: 'year', 'month', 'day', 'hour', 'minute', 'second', 'dayOfWeek', 'dayOfYear'.
date.time.part.title: date.time.part

defaultSnippets.label: InsertWallclockDateTimePart - Insert year
defaultSnippets.description: Insert the current year into a header. Available parts: year, month, day, hour, minute, second, dayOfWeek, dayOfYear. Replace header name as needed.
defaultSnippets.markdownDescription:
**InsertWallclockDateTimePart** (Lenses) - Insert the current year into a header.

**Available parts:** `year`, `month`, `day`, `hour`, `minute`, `second`, `dayOfWeek`, `dayOfYear`

**Use case:** Extract specific date/time components for routing, partitioning, or filtering. Year is useful for multi-year data partitioning.

**Example:** Year `2024` inserted as header value.

defaultSnippets.label: InsertWallclockDateTimePart - Insert hour
defaultSnippets.description: Insert the current hour (0-23) into a header. Useful for hourly partitioning or filtering. Replace header name as needed.
defaultSnippets.markdownDescription:
**InsertWallclockDateTimePart** (Lenses) - Insert the current hour (0-23) into a header.

Useful for hourly partitioning or filtering. Replace header name as needed.

**Use case:** Extract hour component for time-based routing or partitioning. Sink connectors can use this header to organize data into hourly directories.

**Example:** Hour `14` (2 PM) inserted as header value.

defaultSnippets.label: InsertWallclockDateTimePart - Insert day of week
defaultSnippets.description: Insert the day of week (1-7, where 1 is Monday) into a header. Useful for day-based routing or filtering. Replace header name as needed.
defaultSnippets.markdownDescription:
**InsertWallclockDateTimePart** (Lenses) - Insert the day of week (1-7, where 1 is Monday) into a header.

Useful for day-based routing or filtering. Replace header name as needed.

**Use case:** Route messages differently on weekdays vs weekends, or filter data by day of week for reporting.

**Values:** 1=Monday, 2=Tuesday, ..., 7=Sunday
